channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Dynasty Warriors: Origins to get major DLC, Dynasty Warriors remaster teased
item.content:encoded:
Koei Tecmo has released an anniversary trailer for the Dynasty Warriors franchise which is now 25 years old. In the trailer, there is a flythrough of clips from across the games from the very beginning to Origins and it shows the evolutions that the series has gone through while maintaining the core gameplay. You can check out the trailer below.

The Dynasty Warriors anniversary trailer ends with two bits of big news for the series. The first is Dynasty Warriors Origins will be getting a major DLC, but there are no details on what that will entail. The second piece of news is that a Dynasty Warriors game will be getting remastered, but Koei Tecmo has not confirmed which of the games will get that treatment.

In our Dynasty Warriors: Origins review, Jim said, “As someone who has zealously played every entry in the series since its inception more than two decades ago, I’d say Dynasty Warriors: Origins is the best Musou game ever. After years of unsurprising reiteration and plenty of misfires, Omega Force has delivered a smart and super polished reinvention of the Musou franchise that corrects so many of its past shortcomings.”

Source: YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/03/dynasty-warriors-origins-to-get-major-dlc-dynasty-warriors-remaster-teased/

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 02/08/25
item.content:encoded:
We had an exciting week for gamers, with two digital showcases, the big Battlefield 6 reveal, and plenty more on the continuing controversies over payment providers and the UK OSA.

In the News This Week

A bumper crop of news, so let’s dive straight in.

  • Darksiders 4 announcement teaser confirms co-op and more
  • Battlefield 6 launches 10th October
  • Fatekeeper is a relic hunting RPG by former SpellForce 3 devs
  • Titan Quest 2 Early Access is out now!
  • The price of a Nintendo Switch to change in the United States
  • Nintendo Switch 2 set a huge new console sales record in its first month
  • The Adventures of Elliot is a new HD-2D adventure, and there’s a demo out today
  • Octopath Traveler 0 is a HD-2D prequel coming later this year
  • Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection announced with its first action-packed trailer
  • Sony sue Tencent over Light of Motiram, their “slavish clone” of Horizon
  • Xbox adds age verification in the UK for the Online Safety Act
  • Atari set to acquire controlling stake in Thunderful Games
  • August 2025’s PS Plus Monthly Games include Lies of P

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Let’s start with the reviews, because we had so, so many of them!

  • Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 9/10
  • Achilles Survivor – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, PC – 9/10
  • Atomic Owl – PC – 8/10
  • Tales of the Shire – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 7/10
  • Killing Floor 3 – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 7/10
  • Birdigo – PC – 7/10
  • Wildgate – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 7/10
  • Once Upon A Puppet – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 7/10
  • Dear Me, I Was – NSW2 – 6/10

We also had a pair of hardware reviews, first going finger tapping across the Keychron K2 HE keyboard and then spinning the crank on the Playdate and its Season 2 games

Dom had a preview for Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar, but I got to go hands on with Battlefield 6 multiplayer, ahead of the open betas that will arrive over the coming fortnight.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Battlefield 6, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound & Tales of the Shire.

Trailer Park

Darksiders 4 is continuing the story from the original game

See the Battlefield 6 multiplayer trailer & beta reveal

Once Upon A Katamari revealed, and it’s coming out in October

Mario Paint is now on Switch Online, and it even has mouse controls

That’s the round up for this week’s round up, enjoy the weekend and we’ll see you for more gaming gubbins on Monday.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/02/something-for-the-weekend-02-08-25/
